alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FAIRFIELD AND CENTRAL PICKAWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 511 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Williamsport, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Circleville, Ashville, Baltimore, South Bloomfield, Bremen, Williamsport, Pleasantville, Logan Elm Village, Hide-A-Way Hills, Royalton, Lithopolis, Fox, Amanda, Thurston, Stoutsville, Carroll, Rushville, Tarlton and Darbyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
